reviewText: Lo terminé y no me dieron  ningún certificado, ya no sé que hacer.

although you will learn alot in the course in regards to compliance, the history of compliance, different regulating bodies, case studies, this certificate is a waste of time. i completed the Regulatory Compliance Specialization, i invested hours of time, spent the money for the certificate only to find out the certificate has a huge disclaimer stamped to the front of it which says its not a degree, its not the same as taking it on campus, it has no credit, and completely marginalizes the effort of the individual. the certificate might as well be written on a napkin as that's how potential and current employers are going to view it.
Bad
Its a good course, but very american, it doesnt have a world view. The GDPR wanst well discussed like HIPAA.
I really enjoyed the first two courses in this specialization, but I found this course to be focused too heavily on HIPAA and just not as interesting as the other two.

I know the course is by an American college, but there is an over-focus on American information. As this course is a MOOC, you would expect that the content covered would be more general and only use specific examples to help support ideas. An entire section was dedicated to the American health insurance system, which was just incredibly repetitive and uninteresting. As many of your students are from outside the US you should consider this.
I would like to see more reading reference articles, real life custodians of data and their organizations that have had breeches and have these be guest lectures.
Well done however it was heavily focused on HIPAA.
H​elpful!!
needed more of GDPR than HIPPAA
It is slightly too focus on HIPPA, if it weigh in more in GDPR that will be perfect!

Great course. The principles taught are relevant and well thought out and even for those not based in the U.S., they are appropriate and relevant for application in other commonwealth jurisdictions. I would recommend the course to anyone offering data protection as a service.
It shares the principles of data privacy, to build an effective program in the companies. Those tools, will permit to avoid disclosures or violate constitutional rights

Even though the class mainly focuses on the US,  the history behind privacy rules and Fair Information Principles is of relevance to all interested in and working with privacy law. Also nice to see that they have included some material on GDPR and cross-border regulation. A good place to start if you want to learn more about Privacy Law.
there should have some more details on global context and may be an comparison
Great course.
I found the course extremely interesting, but I think that the peer reviewing system should be changed and improved.
Great course
Good overview of general principles of privacy law and data protection.

Good course. Helped without a doubt to get a better understanding of the subject. Personally, I wish it would provide more supplemental media recommendations (articles, books, youtube videos, etc.) as the field is quite broad.
Its a great cours for those who does not have a clue about USA privacy law. If you want to make your first step, this is a great opportunity.
Despite its short duration, the course has all the necessary introductory materials for a ground breaker on compliance
Good education
good
IT WAS TRULY EDUCATIVE AND INTENSE.
thanks
It was a wonderful and insightful learning experience. I would not wish for a better experience than this. I do hope it helps me in my career pursuit.
excellent
great course for the specialization.  Really enjoying the compliance track.  Professional presentation and very well put together.
This course was highly informative, easy to learn, and interesting. It was quite engaging and well-structured including the assessments.
This is a good course for someone interested in Privacy Law and Data Protection.
Excelente curso asi como las modalidades de aprendizaje y el material proporcionado. Gracias por la oportunidad!
A very excellent session with a versed tutor
Very useful and informative course
Thank you for giving opportunity to join this course. It was very interesting .
G​reat course, it's not very dense. Do-able for any busy person.
Really nice contents and very good instructors.
Thank you to Coursera and the University of Pennsylvania for the excellent course. God bless! ♥
It was an amazing experience, since this is my first course. It was nice to learn about the privacy laws of different countries and the difference they hold from the native country.
Extremely important and beneficial it is a must
Excellent Course.
W​onderful
A​ very good introduction and easy to follow lessons in privacy and the laws about privacy.
E​xcellent
its so great but it had to have several professors
excellent
This is a valuable course that is essential for everyone who is entrusted with privacy protection duties.
Excellent 👌
Excellent course. Easy to follow and understand.
Interesting and usefull course on the topic. However I would have appreciated it even more if the focus was more international with deeper analysis of the GDPR. Too much focus on the HIPPA.

Excellent theme and always current. Discuss the importance of data security and personal information privacy is part of the nowadays scenario where the concern with how our personal information are used and for what purpose, always having in mind mechanisms to protect that information from theft, misuse, violation and breach.

Professor Steinfeld was clear and to the point.  She provided background to the material.  The organizing principles and sources of the rules, regulations and laws governing the current practice.  She provided exercises that highlighted real-world examples of concerns and solutions. In the end, I believe myself to be more prepared to address management and oversight of  Privacy and Data protection at my company going forward.
Gostei muito do curso, especialmente por nos trazer conhecimento mais de perto sobre a legislação americana que envolve o assunto!
Good course if you want an introduction/gateway into HIPAA and the US legislative approach to data privacy and protection.

The course gave me insights into Fair Information Principles, HIPPA guidelines, GDPR, and FTC enforcement. In a single course, one can learn the fundamentals of Data Privacy Principles and why it is of utmost importance for compliance officers in any company dealing with customer data or information. The course is optimum even for someone who wants to know about the importance of data privacy in this age and time and how one should protect consumer data information and avoid law enforcement actions. Great course!

Great overview of Privacy Law and Data Protection. Format can be slightly improved to ease future reference to course material. But content is very well tuned to the scope. Thanks a lot for the learning!
This was a challenging and in-depth course. I am grateful to have learned about privacy challenges, laws, and policies.
The professor is excellent. She exposes in a very clear and convincing way aspects of private, administrative and international law that are not as simple as we may think.
GREAT

Very easy to understand, but at the same time provides a very good introduction to the subject. After this Course is a lot easier to understand these areas of knowledge and know what other courses we must look for.
extremely detailed into hipaa! but interesting. and compliance ppl need to know their stuff, right?

Data protection is one of the most important new skills to learn about this decade, it is growing and demanding new job positions. Which is great for Compliance Professionals who whishes to learn new things and make minimun changes in their professional carrier.
Very good course, however it should have more descriptive content and a greater number of classes, due to the interest of great resourcefulness today.
I liked the tutor's approach to abstract and present difficult  topic in a simple manner in a way that it was  easy to understand.
This Course was excellent and very informative, as Privacy and protection of personal information is a topical issue in this electronic era...
good
Excellent course
good course

Lecture are easy to follow and most of the articles included great examples on the topics. For the instructors: I would recommend using different articles, as some were not accessible unless you had a subscription.
This what worth my time. I hope it translates to landing great job opportunities
This course of all 4 was just amazing. Learnt a lot of knew things about Privacy and Data Protection.
It’s very useful course
Professor is highly recommended.
This was a very informative course with practical examples from the instructor.
Great overview of privacy and data protection. Heavy emphasis on HIPAA given Lecturer background and expertise. Would recommend to any beginners or curious individuals.
excelente
Thank you coursera
Great content
Excellent course
Excellent!
Good course that provides a very basic overview of privacy regulation and law in the USA. It is good for people that have never studied the system.
Excellent course.
Its structured very well and a great facilitator

A very good overview of privacy law and data protection.  My only complaint is that it is a tad too easy and the final paper writing assignment, which is graded by peer, can have a higher grading standard.
One of the best courses I have attended. The lectures were excellent.
Great course! Thank you for a great experience!
Excellent course!!
Excellent course.
Excellent introductory course to the US privacy law and data protection framework. I highly recommend it!
Really good course

I thought this course was well organized and thought out. I appreciated that it included a brief segment on the CCPA. I actually would love if in the future they built out the CCPA section a bit more since that seems particularly relevant in today's landscape.

This Course is very instructive and interactive. It helped me understand and do a comparative analysis between the US data protection regulatory framework and the Nigerian NDPR which is quite similar to the EU-GDPR framework.
muy bueno, hace analizar el cumplimiento de todas las leyes que estan sujetas las empresas segun su giro de negocio.
I learned a lot. thank you :)
Great course
A great review of the law, history and current standing for privacy & also  (some) related national security law concepts. Highly enjoyable!
Fantastic!
Thank you very much for this effort in the work of this training course, which is one of the most important courses in the field of data privacy protection

I found this course to be very interesting. Lauren Steinfeld of the University of Pennsylvania was an amazing teacher and always found a way to summarise vital concepts and points in a succinct manner. The course was also exposed me to multi-jurisdictional aspects of privacy law in the US and Europe and this helped me to appreciate the way privacy and data protection are treated in different parts of the world.
This course allows you to structure information on the protection of personal data and learn how to use this information.

Good overview of privacy law, both US FIP and EU GDPR.  Would have preferred if the example privacy law explored in Week 2 were something finance-related like FDCPA or FACTA/FCRA, rather than HIPPA, but the discussions were good (including a quick dive into data security and cyber threat protection).

This course covering legal Issues, HIPPA and privacy topics proved to be the most challenging of the 4 courses.  I need to go back and review this section and take it a bit slower next time.  However everything in there was broken down nicely and supplied great supplemental examples.
Great Course! Thank you PenState for creating this material!
Great content and delivery by the professor.
Excellent!
Amazing curse and specialization.

Professor Steinfeld is extremely knowledgeable, responsive and she provides an engaging learning experience. I really enjoyed learning through the useful combination of video and content. A tremendous help to anyone interested in learning more about the privacy landscape.
Good introductory course.
This course is interesting as it introduces us to the US privacy regime.

This is a very good course. It gave me an overview knowledge of the data privacy protections both in the US (HIPAA, FERMA, COPPA) and Europe (GDPR). I would highly recommend for anyone trying to learn about the basic regimes of data privacy.
Outstanding.
Great course.
It's a very insightful and provocative look into the emerging privacy landscape

I am quite familiar with the privacy regime in the EU and other individual States such as Malaysia and Australia but this course gave me an important perspective on privacy and information security particularly from a US perspective.
Fabulous, very informative.
